title: Barnardo's says charity shops are saving the high street, not hurting it
text:
Think about the usual fare on offer from Britain's armada of charity shops, and an £800 designer suit does not immediately come to mind.

But not every store on the high street has the same mix of old DVDs, second-hand sofas and well-worn shoes.

At Barnardo's most exclusive outlet in Marylebone, high fashion hand-me-downs are the norm - and a few wealthy donors help to deliver a healthy £200,000 annual profit.

The central London charity shop sold a men's suit for £800 earlier this year, while Jimmy Choo shoes priced at £220 and a Coach leather bag for £139 were also on offer.

To some shoppers they symbolise the sad decline by Britain's once-thriving high street, cropping up in empty spaces where...
description: Think about the usual fare on offer from Britain's armada of charity shops, and an £800 designer suit does not immediately come to mind.
